qas.question: What kind of problem caused riots in June 2012?
How long were cities without electricity in June 2012?
Where were there riots in June 2012?

answers.text: Gujranwala, Toba Tek Singh, Faisalabad, Sialkot, Bahawalnagar and communities across Khanewal District

qas.question: Which energy companies' offices were attacked by rioters?
When was Pakistan's electricity problem solved?
How long was the rioting on 17 June 2012?
What city houses the offices of Fesco?
Who was responsible for the load shedding?

context: As of <b4_0>June 2012<b4_0/>[update], Pakistan's <a0_0>electricity<a0_0/> problems were so severe that violent riots were taking place across Punjab. According to <b8_0>protesters<b8_0/>, load shedding was depriving the cities of electricity <a1_0><b5_0>20–22 hours<b5_0/> a day<a1_0/>, causing businesses to go bust and making living extremely hard. <a2_0>Gujranwala, Toba Tek Singh, Faisalabad, <b6_0>Sialkot<b6_0/>, Bahawalnagar and communities across Khanewal District<a2_0/> saw widespread rioting and violence on Sunday 17 June 2012, with the houses of several members of parliament being attacked as well as the offices of regional energy suppliers <a3_0><b7_0>Fesco, Gepco and Mepco<b7_0/><a3_0/> being ransacked or attacked.
